event: Early Mesoamerican cultures, including the Olmecs and later Pipil people, inhabit the region.
Spanish conquistadors led by Pedro de Alvarado begin the conquest of El Salvador.
El Salvador is fully incorporated into the Spanish Empire as part of the Captaincy General of Guatemala.
El Salvador declares independence from Spain along with other Central American provinces.
El Salvador joins the United Provinces of Central America.
El Salvador becomes fully independent after the dissolution of the Central American Federation.
Military coup brings General Maximiliano Hernández Martínez to power.
La Matanza: Thousands of indigenous people massacred after a peasant uprising.
El Salvador and Honduras fight the brief 'Football War' over immigration and land disputes.
Military coup sparks the beginning of the Salvadoran Civil War.
Archbishop Óscar Romero assassinated while saying Mass; becomes a martyr and later a saint.
Massacre at El Mozote where hundreds of civilians are killed by the army.
Peace accords signed between government and FMLN guerrillas, ending 12-year civil war.
U.S. dollar adopted as official currency.
Mauricio Funes becomes first leftist president from FMLN party.
Salvador Sánchez Cerén, former guerrilla leader, elected president.
El Salvador becomes first country in the world to adopt Bitcoin as legal tender.
President Nayib Bukele declares war on gangs, leading to mass arrests and security crackdown.
